title: The Zero Product Property
text: The zero product property says if the product of two quantities is zero, it must be that at least one of the quantities is zero.
speech: The zero product property says if the product of two quantities is zero, it must be that at least one of the quantities is zero.
pacedSpeech: The zero product property says if the product of two quantities is zero, it must be that at least one of the quantities is zero.

title: Factoring the Equation
text: We can factor $$20x^2-60x+45$$ to use the zero product property. $$20x^2-60x+45=5(2x-3)(2x-3)$$
speech: We can factor  20 x squared, minus 60 x plus, 45  to use the zero product property.  20 x squared minus 60 x plus 45 is equal to 5 times, parentheses, 2 x minus 3,  times, parentheses, 2 x minus 3,
pacedSpeech: We can factor   20 x squared, minus 60 x plus, 45
to use the zero product property.   20 x squared minus 60 x plus 45 is equal to 5 times, , 2 x minus 3,  times, , 2 x minus 3,

title: Using the Zero Product Property
text: As per the zero product property, if $$5(2x-3)(2x-3)=0$$, then either $$2x-3=0$$. We get $$x=\frac{3}{2}$$. Since $$(2x-3)$$ is squared, we double $$\frac{3}{2}$$ to get $$3$$
speech: As per the zero product property, if  5 times, parentheses, 2 x minus 3,  times, parentheses, 2 x minus 3,  is equal to, 0 , then either  2 x, minus 3 is equal to 0 . We get  x, is equal to 3 halves . Since , parentheses, 2 x minus 3,   is squared, we double  3 halves  to get  3

, then either   2 x, minus 3 is equal to 0
. We get   x, is equal to 3 halves
